title: How do I restore in v 88.0 'Bookmark this page' where it now says 'Bookmrk this tab'
content:

I want to bookmrk a PAGE not a TAB.

How do I alter this please - or do I have to change to Safari
creator: ad16

title: Google takes forever to load
content:
Well, slow loading site is not a new question. But my problem is that I can't search on google from the URL bar when I press ctrl + l. I actually search on google, but it loads very slow. But if I again open a new tab and go to google.com, while the search is loading in the previous tab, it instantly loads google on both of the tabs. So when I search something on the URL bar, I have to also open another tab and type google.com, or straight just go to google.com and search for something.

I have already tried clearing the cache. I am straight up using Google's primary (1), secondary (2), and cloudflare's primary (3) DNS. I don't face the issue with Chromium for example, and also linux commands like dig google.com and drill google.com are instantaneous.

I previously used dnsmasq and same issue, I disabled it, and the issue still persists. It's annoying. I have no trouble loading sites like duckduckgo.

I am on Archlinux, but I am using the official firefox build coming from mozilla.org. The current firefox version is 88.0b3 (64-bit) (autoupdates disabled).
creator: SouravGoswami

title: Firefox V88 lädt Seiten quälend langsam oder gar nicht, trotz nagelneuem Macbook (Big Sur) und frischer Neuinstallation FF!!
content:
Firefox V88 lädt Seiten quälend langsam oder gar nicht, trotz nagelneuem Macbook (Big Sur) und frischer Neuinstallation FF!! Bei der neuen Hardware sollte der FF flitzen, aber es ist genau anders rum. So langsam war ein FF nicht mal vor 10 Jahren. Wo liegt das Problem? Bei Big Sur? Bei Apple? Bei FF? Bei mir? Dann höchstens am Synchronisieren, denn sonst habe ich nix mit dem frisch geladenen und installierten FF gemacht. So ist er unbrauchbar. Safari läuft schnell. Google Chrome läuft schnell. Das alte Macbook (Mojave) mit FF78 läuft schnell.

Und Feedback an Mozilla ist unmöglich! Der Link zum Feedback auf der Feedback-Seite führt nur auf diese Seite zurück, und eben nicht zu einer möglichen Eingabe für ein Feedback. ( https://qsurvey.mozilla.com/s3/Give-feedback-landing-page ) Ist Feedback nicht mehr gewollt?

Wer kann gegen meine Enttäuschung was tun? bzw. wie kann dieses Enttäuschtsein über diesen FF wieder in Freude am FF gewandelt werden? Danke
creator: uhmp57

title: FF no longer plays Amazon videos in HD - Chrome has no issues and plays fine
content:
Whenever I play a video on amazon prime thru FF it is SD. When I go to the options for video it says HD is unavailable even if best is selected. When the video first plays the HD icon will come up for about a second, but faded, than go away right after. Usually when it does that it becomes solid white and shows HD at 1080.

When I try watching the same videos in Chrome I have no issues and the content plays fine in HD 1080p.

I tried removing all history, refreshing FF, uninstalling and re-installing my NVIDIA drivers but same issue. I am on 88.0. No add ons or themes. Just default FF after refresh. Nothing helps.

I have seen other reports of widevine crashing but I dont have that issue. FF just wont play Amazon video in HD anymore.
creator: arugula

The annoying thing about it though is that it syncs that bookmark to my other PCs which leads to nowhere on them. Is there a way to exclude certain bookmarks from Sync? I tried searching for something like that but couldn't find anything.

title: Two-sided printing is not working
content:
There are two uploaded images.

One is the advanced preferences setting showing that the duplex flag for the printer is correctly set to two-sided printing.

The other is the settings on the Print menu (CTRL + P) with the selection of two-sided printing. However, there are 5 single pages and it was not halved to 3 pages. Switching between single-sided printing and two-sided printing does not change the amount of pages printed number.

If I print anyways, it comes out single sided. I've refreshed my settings, reinstalled Firefox, ran in safe mode and it still does not work. However, in a different browsers and applications, the two-sided printing work correctly.

What is wrong with the two-sided printing?

title: The screen content is automatically reduced
content:
Hello, I have had a problem with the zoom function for a short time. When I press the Ctrl key (for example, when I want to insert something, Ctrl-V), the screen content is reduced to 90%, the next time it is clicked to 80%, etc. I've already changed the keyboard with no result.

Furthermore, the pop-up window no longer opens. For example, when shopping I can no longer change the number of items via the window or change the date when entering years. When I click the Quantity button, the window opens very briefly and then closes again immediately

I also noticed the following: When I open Google Maps, it briefly shows me the standard view of my surroundings in normal size. Then the map zooms in to the highest resolution and then I have to zoom out again with the scroll wheel

title: Moving bookmarks within drop down
content:
For all past years, when I save bookmarks, they go to the bottom of my drop down icon. Then I double-click-drag to where I want them in my drop down list. In the past week or so, I can no longer do this. It seems Facebook now forces us to open the bookmarks window???? That's a whole lot of extra steps! In over a decade of Firefox I've maybe opened the bookmarks window a 10 times!

Bring back the ability to move bookmarks in one-quick-step. Why must all firefox "upgrades" make using firefox slower :(

title: One day my profile just got deleted for no reason.
content: Soo... here is the deal. I was just using the browser when one day my profile that I browsed in just got deleted. Well... not really deleted but secured by a password I did not know. So I amde a new profile and manually moved all my files. That was about 2 months ago. Yesterday I have found out that for some reason most of my history got deleted (In spite of me moving my previous browser history and bookmark files from the other profile) and most of my bookmarks got deleted along with it. Is there anything I can do to get back my browsing history? I got some important stuff there and it would be a shame to lose it.

title: Fullscreen-mode won't hide tabs- and address-bar

I see this behavior since the first install of Firefox on this device, but now I'd like to ask if this is "way it works" or if it's kinda bug.

Fullscreen on my device looks like the image attached to this post.
creator: plausibel

title: Firefox on macOS 11.2.3 (20D91) enters dark-mode, but won't leave.
content:
Hello altogether. I sat up my MacBook to automatically enter light or dark mode. Firefox enters dark mode as expected but won't leave. Even if I restart the MacBook the next day, while the system boots with light mode enabled, Firefox will remain in dark mode.

To change this temporarily, I have to open the macOS settings and enable light mode. Firefox now change to light mode and stays in light mode, even if I again re-enable the automatic changing in the macOS settings.

Later those days, Firefox enters dark mode as expected but won't leave, like described before.

Is this a known bug? Anything else I can try?

Thanks for reading, looking forward to a possible solution.
creator: plausibel

title: WidevineCdm Plugin issue

title: WebRTC video bandwidth test at test.webrtc.org always fails 88.0 64-bit and 89.0b4 64-bit
content:
This problem seems the same that Seren reported with FF 75 and 76 that was fixed in 76.0.1. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1286300. It would be good to know that FF will work with remote presenters joining a webcast via Telestream's Wirecast Rendezvous no matter what browser they're using. Other browsers tested were Chrome 90.0.4430.93, Edge 90.0.818.49, and Opera 75.0.3969.243. They all work; only Firefox reports this problem in both 88 and 89 (Windows 10 64-bit).

Firefox: Throughput Data throughput [ OK ] Transmitting at 515.066 kbps. [ OK ] Transmitting at 521.68 kbps. [ OK ] Transmitting at 526.166 kbps. [ OK ] Transmitting at 522.72 kbps. [ OK ] Transmitting at 523.764 kbps. [ OK ] Total transmitted: 2629.632 kilo-bits in 5.038 seconds. Video bandwidth [ FAILED ] Frame rate mean is 0, cannot test bandwidth without a working camera. [ INFO ] Send bitrate mean: NaN kbps [ INFO ] Send bitrate standard deviation: NaN kbps [ INFO ] RTT average: 0 ms [ INFO ] RTT max: 0 ms [ INFO ] Packets lost: -1

BTW, the camera tests all work - green check marks on all: why no camera here?

Typical results (from Edge): Throughput Data throughput [ OK ] Transmitting at 1512.495 kbps. [ OK ] Transmitting at 1561.549 kbps. [ OK ] Transmitting at 1579.477 kbps. [ OK ] Transmitting at 1581.341 kbps. [ OK ] Transmitting at 1550.279 kbps. [ OK ] Total transmitted: 7847.936 kilo-bits in 5.039 seconds. Video bandwidth [ OK ] Video resolution: 1280x720 [ INFO ] Send bandwidth estimate average: 3621 kbps [ INFO ] Send bandwidth estimate max: 4873.574 kbps [ INFO ] Send bandwidth ramp-up time: 318 ms [ INFO ] Packets sent: 9000 [ INFO ] Packets received: 8983 [ INFO ] NACK count: 0 [ INFO ] Picture loss indications: 0 [ INFO ] Quality predictor sum: 2576 [ INFO ] Frames encoded: 296 [ INFO ] Frames decoded: 295 [ INFO ] RTT average: 69 ms [ INFO ] RTT max: 77 ms [ INFO ] Packets lost: 0

Anyone have a clue as to what might be going on? Why is the data one-third of what Edge is transmitting? Is FF blocking access to the camera for some reason for this test even though the web site is allowed access to both the camera and microphone in Settings?
creator: moz1

title: Increase back button history drop down length
content:
Hi, I want to be able to quickly go back to earlier pages I've viewed without having to spam click the back button / Alt+Left and re-request those previous pages. I can see the back button history drop down is a great tool for this, however the history entries seem limited to the past 15 pages or so. Is there a configuration value that one can modify to increase this limit? Alternatively, what are some good resources for overriding this menu with an addon that presents a custom control instead? I'm not afraid to write my own if need be, however I believe that one already existed for a previous version of Firefox (maybe even older than FF 4!!!), and never was updated.

Attached is the menu I am referring to in case it has a specific name in the codebase that may make it hard to find.

Thanks!
